reviews.sentence: Suggest Disneys Quality Service program for maintenance and housekeeping staff or for those who manage them to make the experience semles for the customer. Wait staff is great and food is good. There is an added resort fee for very little mostly morning yoga and the gym. Beautiful property but very noisy with crew always cleaning during peak hours ei rolling a gigantic Laundry basket through ahula show. Our Garden view room is overlooks the air conditioning unit but we can see a tree sticking out over the top. Pool is cold and not heated. Have had to ask for either clean sheets or towels every day. I guess it is all relative if you are looking for an inexpensive place to see Kauai do not want to hang at the hotel a place with lots of noise and children running around with no parental supervision this is the place for you.

Sufficient. This place is not bad. The service personnel are friendly and accommodating. The place could use some updates. Laundry service is available but there is not enough machines available to accommodate guests. The food was good. We really enjoyed breakfast. Only saw one cockroach so that is not bad. I would say that is it overpriced however for what you get.

Wonderful Staff Gorgeous Location and Surroundings Just the Best. We spent 5 truly lovely days at this hotel and came away very impressed with how well this hotel is run. I think that gets to the heart of a good experience at any hotel. how well is it managed. Even the best locations and the fanciest of amenities can be spoiled by bad or sloppy management. This hotel combines an amazing location Kauai is a gorgeous island with plenty of fun balanced by quiet beauty with spotlessly clean surroundings and clearly well trained staff. Our hats off to the whole Mariot teamThe hotel itself is beautiful with a gorgeous beach. Not so good for swimming but they have thoughtfully placed both Adirondack chairs and beach lounges all along the beach area and it is all clean and the landscaping is well groomed. The pool area. and we have a pool ourselves so we pay attention to pool maintenance and almost always find hotel pools lacking but not here. was always clean well maintained and there were plenty of staff available to take care of any needs clean any messes generally make sure that it was always spotless. The polside bar area was clean the staff was friendly and attentive and the Mai Tais were deliciousThe food at the restaurants was very good and the wait staff were friendly and attentive. Presentation was very nice and the breakfast buffet while pricey was very good. Dana Courtney at the Concierge desk was wonderful. She was very helpful very friendly and so easy to work with. She booked the luau for us and gave us lots of good info on things to do around the island and at the hotel. All in all the island was beautiful the hotel was well appointed clean and well run the activities were fun and we had a ball. We are definitely counting the days until we can come here again.

Location is great. This is the second year in a row we have stayed at this hotel. It seemed a little more run down than last year. Staff is still excellent but room interior looking worn out and things like balcony door was corroding and air smelled moldy in room. Eating breakfast on patio was getting challenging as chickens and roosters are getting bolder and at one point jumped up on our table in the middle of the food we just collected from the buffet breaking glassware and spilling liquids over us and our belongings. Also cats are now roaming throughout the first floor. Food menu was the same as last year too would like to see a little more variety offered. The staff and location Beaches throughout island are awesome. Poipu Princevile and Waimea fun to visit. Waimea was a great visit with its stunning views. Change up the menu get rid of animals near eating area update rooms and improve air conditioning.

The hotel staff are good but the room condition is not good. The ventilation in our bathroom was broken during our stay. They put heavy perfume when we arrived on the first night but next morning the room was smelly. Then we found out that the ventilator was not working at all. I talked to the front desk about this but they could not fix it during our stay. Actually they were aware of that before my complaint and the rooms next to ours did not have ventilation either. The bathtub drainage was blocked by long hair as well. The room is old and needs renovation.

Surprisingly awful room. I do not know how this place has been so highly rated by so many. My room was really bad see pictures. Rusty moldy dirty tired. I was wondering if they put me in one of their older rooms that had not been remodeled or kept up but it had a beautiful ocean front view so I doubt it. Courtyards are usually fine but this one was surprisingly not even close.

Happy with Choice. The hotel is centrally located with convenient parking. It has a great beach to sit at but not for swimming. Location and parking. Room had a very musty smell. Parts of the hotel are in need of remodeling.

Great place. This could be a phenomenal place but it needs some upgrades and consistency. For example no fan in the bathroom and with the humidity there is mold on ceiling and bath fixtures. However the room was Great. Refrigerator was medium size perfect. Comfy beds great seating area with upholsteted chairs desk and balcony. Sliding doors had plantation shutters. Awesome featureConfusing signage for pool hours. One sign says 7 am another 9 am but actual hour was 8 am. Staff ran out of pool towels. so were handing out bath towels. yet they have a strict key card policy and charge you 25 if you do not turn in correct number of pool towels. Pool water was too cold so too many kids in hot tub. Needs to be adults only. Fernando one of the pool staff was really surley. I think he also had his girlfriend at the pool. He should be fired. All the other pool staff was greatConfusing check in. Lady told us we had free horseback ride on the beach. Next day we were told that it could not possibly be. Bar area staff was equally as spotty with service. Sitting by the pool I tried to order drinks but was told that he only took food orders. I had to go to the bar. We gave up on the waitresses and always ordered from the bartender. Two Laundry rooms on each floor. Ours was broken for 12 our visit. When finally fixed the soap dispensers were gross. but it did wash our clothes really well. Great feature given all the hiking and mud in the area. But they need to update the machines.

highlight was the room location. We had a room on the 1st floor facing the ocean. It was awesome because you could literally walk out of your little lanai and face the sunrise. It was beautiful. The place overall is a bit outdated they are due for a renovation. I did not like the carpet. It also would be nice to have a little walkway to access the beach from the rooms.

Location of room is key. As others have said the hotel does need some updating so I wo n’t dwell on that. Great location for accessing the island and the airport. Beautiful view from our room 340. Loved the nightly music. Our main issue was the layout of the hotel overlooking the pool and ocean. Sounds echoed and carried up to our floor as if we were downstairs. The bar is open air and stays open until 10 pm and we are not night owls. People also talked loudly in the hot tub. We could not sleep unles we closed our slider went to bed and woke up later to open the slider again so we could hear the lovely ocean. If we ’d known that was going to be a problem we would have asked for a different room. FYI.

Never been disappointed by Mariot before but unbelievably disappointed today. We showed up for the last night of our 30th Anniversary trip ready to enjoy one last night in paradise only to find the hotel torn up for renovations. no pool no hotub and no one had the decency to let us know prior to our arrival. Having a background in hospitality I completely understand the need to renovate and that it may will inconvenience guests but to blind side them is unacceptable. We spoke on multiple occasions to the hotel concierge they never said a word either. If we had known that construction was happening we would have not expected to arrive take a nice nap followed by a swim and hot tub with a cocktail prior to our dinner plans. We would have arrived after work was done for the day without expectations of amenities we expected being there. I hope this property will show future guests more respect. These renovations are going to take awhile.
They are doing renovations now but a great room with great views.

Wait til renovation is complete. I do n’t really know how to rate the hotel as it was completely torn apart when we were there. Unfortunately I had no idea that the hotel was undergoing a MASSIVE renovation. Was literally like being on a construction site. No amenities available at the time of our stay. It ’s is well located right on the ocean and the rooms were nice with lovely modern beach decor. I ’m sure it will be great when finished but I ’d stay away during the transition period and was so disappointed upon arrival due to zero notice that it would be a construction zone.
Property is under renovation work. All renovation works be done in two monts. After all construction works this property will be very nice place to stay.

Went during their remodeling from a Mariot Courtyard to becoming a Sheraton. it is going to be a beautiful property. One thing that I do not know how their going to handle is the beach. We were told by the locals that this beach gets tons of driftwood do to tides and being close to a large river. So not like Popiu. They are managing the transition all the work going on pretty well. I had one issue. I am a Lifetime Titanium reward level and one of the benefits at that level is free Breakfast at Courtyards. I made my reservations on Mariots website as it is still a Courtyard they would not honor that benefit. Nor offer any explanation of why or give me points something. They just did not handle it properly.

The rooms were nicely renovated but the pool area was closed which the website did NOT say it stated the property was renovating but not pool specific which is the main amenity I like to use. They shuttled us to a neighboring hotel for pool use but did not pick up their phones to have us picked back up so my handicapped husband had to walk quite a distance back to our hotel.

Updated clean. The property is newly updated from the lobby to the pool bar area to the rooms. It was also spotless. No bugs dust or grime. The ocean view was really nice although we did n’t find ourselves out on the patio often. The bar by the pool has yummy food and the area is also kid friendly. The staff was so sweet and helpful as well every morning we grabbed beach towels on our way out and was greeted with a smile. The beach it is on it not super swimable with reef rock close to the shore but there are plenty of beaches within a mile or 2. The price was a little steep but a clean updated room is well worth it.

Updated clean. The property is newly updated from the lobby to the pool bar area to the rooms. It was also spotless. No bugs dust or grime. The ocean view was really nice although we did n’t find ourselves out on the patio often. The bar by the pool has yummy food and the area is also kid friendly. The staff was so sweet and helpful as well every morning we grabbed beach towels on our way out and was greeted with a smile. The beach it is on it not super swimable with reef rock close to the shore but there are plenty of beaches within a mile or 2. The price was a little steep but a clean updated room is well worth it.
The newly renovated Sheraton way more hip than the previous Courtyard at the Mariot. The rooms and facilities are nicely upgraded.

Excellent location. Lots of delicious food and coffee options nearby. Beach was clean and nice although it was very rocky in most places definitely wear water shoes. The nearby public beach Lydgate was perfect for swimming. We got an updated room but lots of the hotel still under construction. The bathroom was rather small though and no bathtub so trying to bathe baby took some logistical planning. Also toilet is super load when flushing. Loud enough to hear your neighbors flushing. And no air circulater in the bathroom so bring some air fresher. Staff very nice and accommodating. Storage room where the baby cribs are kept definitely had cockroaches so we declined the crib. Did not see any roaches in our room or the hallways. As long as you do not leave any food out you will not attract any bugs. Self service laundry was very expensive. No place to fill up water bottles and coffee only available during early hours unles you order through the restaurant or room service. The pool area was renovated and gorgeous also very slippery. Cellular service was spotty in certain places.
Much improved public areas since this location switched from a “ Courtyard ” to Sheraton. Rooms are more or less the same but also refurbished with better TV etc.

Not a 5 star Sheraton experience but the friendly staff made almost up for it. This hotel used to be a courtyard. It turns out that remodeling was done with the most minimal effort. It all looks pretty now but the untouched structure from the 50s reveals it is issues. The pool is redone very nicely but pool heating would be nice in the winter it was so cold that one at to use a neoprene. Weird was that on all stormy rainy days the hot tub was at a lower temperature that was actually perfect for staying in there for 2 hours on warm days the hot tub was boiling hit though. Not sure is that was intentional. The rooms though turned out to have one big flaw. Instead of re doing all windows and sliding doors they have simply added screen shutters no mosquito net though. During the last night of our stay a storm came through and was howling all night because the sliding door in our room did not close properly. In the morning we noticed that the whole carpet was soaking wet. The staff acknowledged that was an issue with all south facing units and gave us quarters for the dryers. Certainly not Sheraton worthy. I hope they do another round of remodeling to get the quality up.

It all looks pretty now but the untouched structure from the 50s reveals it is issues. Not sure is that was intentional. The rooms though turned out to have one big flaw. Instead of re doing all windows and sliding doors they have simply added screen shutters no mosquito net though. During the last night of our stay a storm came through and was howling all night because the sliding door in our room did not close properly. In the morning we noticed that the whole carpet was soaking wet. The staff acknowledged that was an issue with all south facing units and gave us quarters for the dryers. Certainly not Sheraton worthy. I hope they do another round of remodeling to get the quality up.

Inconsistent service windy beach and not so updated refurbished old hotel. Definitely not up to Sheraton standard. I spent a week with my family 2 kids 10 12 at Sheraton Coconut Beach hotel and definitely not enjoyed the hotel on so many levels. To begin with we requested our room to be ready for 3 pm arrival through the mobile ap and the room was not ready. It was not ready even 2 hours later. They welcomed us with the fact that this is not quite Sheraton hotel and we can not use our status privileges. No breakfast included and pretty much we should have been thankful that we had a room there. Very unpleasant and rude welcome to this hotel. We spend over 80 nights a year with Mariot and have never seen anything like that. Next day different crew and the breakfast was included for us. Lobby staff was very unaware and incompetent in their job based on our stay. Breakfast restaurant Overall very inconsistent service as well. Our lattes had different price every day although our order was exactly the same. The kids juices usually were served at the same time with the bill at the end of breakfast. Rooms I can not quite picture where the remodeling part was. The rooms needed a deep cleaning for sure it felt like whatever they have remodeled they just left and forgot to clean up before allowing people in. The beds are very soft and uncomfortable the pillows are extremely soft do not understand the purpose of it. The daily cleaning service included just the fix of our beds and fresh towels. For the 4 of us they were leaving only 2 towels no matter how many times we requested them to make a note that we need four. One or two towels every day had some kind of stain spots indicating they did not clean them properly. The hotel is on the windiest beach on the island. The beach is nice but you can not really enjoy it due to the wind. The wind never stopped for the entire time we were there. This might be a reason to the tree to be so leaning away towards the hotel. The beach is windy the pool side is windy as well you can not find a place to avoid it no matter where you go. The fire pits around the pool are lovely in the evening but again with so much wind is hard to enjoy even a single drink. The tiles around the pool the breakfast restaurant and the lobby was quite slippery. There were a lot of signs about that but that can not prevent slipping. Why they put such a slippery surface tiles when they remodeled the pool yard. Overall very disappointed stay at this hotel. Definitely the service was not up to SPG standards.
